scripts.title: Lab. Embedded Systems
scripts.description: This script guides students of the HTL-Neufelden through the laboratory Embedded Systems. It teaches students about microcontrollers, embedded systems and Micro Python. In this script the authors show how to read and write analog and digital values, work with a BUS (I2C) and much more. The script also refreshes the readers recolaction about topics like Python and Electronics.
scripts.author: Sebastian Steininger (sebastian.steininger@outlook.com)

scripts.title: Lab. Virtualization & DevOps
scripts.description: This script guides students of the HTL-Neufelden through the laboratory Virtualization & DevOps. Students will learn abou Containerization, Virtualization, Orchestration, etc. in the context of DevOps. The authors provide extensive examples and documentation to solve the provided tasks. The authors employ several tools like Docker, Docker-Compose, Kubernetes and Apache JMeter to provide an interactive learning experience.
scripts.author: Sebastian Steininger (sebastian.steininger@outlook.com)

scripts.title: ProvisionDismPC - Capture & Deploy Windows11 Images
scripts.description: This script explains how to use ProvisonDismPC to capture and deploy a Windows11 virtualized system using Hyper-V.
scripts.author: Sebastian Steininger (sebastian.steininger@outlook.com)

scripts.title: Game Development with PixiJS
scripts.description: This script explains the fundamentals of game development and how to create a game with PixiJs.
scripts.author: Sebastian Steininger (sebastian.steininger@outlook.com)

scripts.title: Machine Learning
scripts.description: Begin your machine learning journey with this script, which details basic algorithms like KNN, DBSCAN, and Decision Trees. It then guides you through crucial feature engineering steps, such as normalization and imputation. Note that deep learning is covered in a separate, follow-up script.
scripts.author: FÃ¼rlinger Simon, Sebastian Steininger (sebastian.steininger@outlook.com)

scripts.title: LLM Prompting: Foundations for Responsible Use
scripts.description: Unlock the full potential of Large Language Models (LLMs) with this comprehensive script on prompt engineering. Learn fundamental principles, advanced techniques like Chain-of-Thought, and critical strategies for adaptive prompting. Crucially, this guide emphasizes responsible AI use, covering vital ethical considerations such as bias, hallucinations, privacy, and the creation of AI agents. Ideal for anyone looking to interact with LLMs effectively and ethically.
scripts.author: Sebastian Steininger (sebastian.steininger@outlook.com)
